bug_reporting.title: Bug reporting
bug_reporting.introduction: If you've submitted a bug via GitHub, debug logs can help us track down the problem.
bug_reporting.description: Debug logs contain application usage data including your username, the IDs or aliases of the rooms you have visited, which UI elements you last interacted with, and the usernames of other users. They do not contain messages.
bug_reporting.matrix_security_issue: To report a Matrix-related security issue, please read the Matrix.org Security Disclosure Policy.
bug_reporting.create_new_issue: Please <newIssueLink>create a new issue</newIssueLink> on GitHub so that we can investigate this bug.
bug_reporting.before_submitting: Before submitting logs, you must create a GitHub issue to describe your problem.
bug_reporting.additional_context: If there is additional context that would help in analysing the issue, such as what you were doing at the time, room IDs, user IDs, etc., please include those things here.

<b>It's not recommended to add encryptio: It's not recommended to add encryption to public rooms. Anyone can find and join public rooms, so anyone can read messages in them. You'll get none of the benefits of encryption, and you won't be able to turn it off later. Encrypting messages in a public room will make receiving and sending messages slower.
To avoid these issues, create a <a>new e: To avoid these issues, create a new encrypted room for the conversation you plan to have.
Once enabled, encryption for a room cann: Once enabled, encryption for a room cannot be disabled. Messages sent in an encrypted room cannot be seen by the server, only by the participants of the room. Enabling encryption may prevent many bots and bridges from working correctly.
